[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The University Management System (UMS) defines requirements for managing departments, personnel, offices, and classrooms.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: UMS supports university structure, department allocations, personnel assignments, and facility tracking.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: UMS integrates with university databases and facility management systems for real-time updates on department structures and faculty workload tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: UMS provides administrative dashboards for personnel and department management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: UMS operates on university computing devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: UMS supports PostgreSQL for storage and integrates with HR records via REST APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: UMS secures data transmission using HTTPS, OAuth 2.0, and JWT authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: UMS optimizes storage for personnel and facility data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: UMS ensures continuous availability with scheduled maintenance and data backups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: UMS is configurable for diverse university structures.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: UMS links with academic planning and facility tracking systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: UMS facilitates department management, personnel assignments, and facility tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: UMS serves university administrators, faculty, and facility managers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: UMS requires internet connectivity for real-time updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: UMS depends on HR systems and academic databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Department: Academic unit managing offices and personnel.
Classroom: University facility with an ID and seat count.
Professor: Faculty member categorized as Full, Associate, or Assistant Professor.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with university databases for personnel and facilities.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall communicate with HR systems for professor and employee records.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall assign professors to departments (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall ensure every employee is assigned an office.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interactive dashboard for personnel and department assignments.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall load department data within 2 seconds under normal load and within 3 seconds during peak usage with 1,000 concurrent users.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall process personnel assignments within 3 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store department details, personnel records, and facilities.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique identification for personnel and facilities.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with university data policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log department and personnel updates, retaining audit logs for 12 months.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Verification includes department management, personnel assignments, and facility tracking tests.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, onboarding tutorials, sample API requests, and compliance training guides for university staff.
[SEC] 5. References: University data policies and facility tracking guidelines.
